other_tests.findings: Irregular rhythm with high-amplitude, mildly prolonged QRS complexes consistent with atrial fibrillation, rapid ventricular response, left ventricular hypertrophy, and interventricular conduction delay.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After electrical cardioversion, showed sinus rhythm with multifocal atrial ectopic depolarizations, short PR interval with a delta wave, interventricular conduction delay, ST-segment and T-wave abnormalities, and increased precordial QRS amplitudes.

other_tests.findings: Severe, concentric biventricular hypertrophy with normal systolic function, moderate-to-severe biatrial enlargement, and small circumferential pericardial effusion.
Markedly reduced, at 0.4 nmol per hour per milligram.
Nonsense mutation in the second exon of GLA, the gene encoding α-galactosidase.
Enhanced atrioventricular conduction and multifocal atrial tachycardia with preexcitation due to a fasciculoventricular pathway.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Following treatment with amiodarone, resulted in substantial improvement in arrhythmia and other symptoms.
